text: Fazlabad is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Fazlabad. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch, who is an elected representative. == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Fazlabad has a total number of 134 houses and population of 735 of which include 397 males and 338 females. Literacy rate of Fazlabad is 83.21%, higher than state average of 75.84%. The population of children under the age of 6 years is 74 which is 10.07% of total population of Fazlabad, and child sex ratio is approximately 721, lower than state average of 846. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" !
